oai_dc:dc.dc:title: THE MEASUREMENT OF OFFSHORE SHINGLE MOVEMENT
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Crickmore, M.J.
Waters, C.B.
Price, W.A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: offshore shingle
movement measurement
shingle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The objective was to obtain quantitative data on the movement of shingle under wave action in water depths of about 10 to 20 m by tracking pebbles tagged with radioactive material. The paper describes the method of tagging, the method of position fixing, and the development of an underwater detection vehicle with a wide field of view. The field tracer tests demonstrated both increased mobility with decreasing depth and the existence of a small landward movement of shingle inshore of a depth of 12 m. Existing predictive data on the threshold of movement under waves, based on the results of previous work in the laboratory, was confirmed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 13 (1972): Proceedings of 13th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Vancouver, Canada, 1972.; 50
